      • setLineColorDefault

        public void setLineColorDefault(org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Color color)
        Sets a new color that will be used for drawing standard lines.

        Note: When this viewer is disposed, it will not dispose of the color. It is up to the user to do it. One must make sure not to dispose of the color before the viewer has finished using it (i.e. is disposed).

        Parameters:
        color - new default line color

      • getLineColorDefault

        public org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Color getLineColorDefault()
        Returns the color that will be used when doing default line drawing.
        Returns:
        line color for default lines
        See Also:
        getLineColorSelection()

      • setLineColorSelected

        public void setLineColorSelected(org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Color color)
        Sets a new color that will be used for drawing lines that are selected.

        Note: When this viewer is disposed, it will not dispose of the color. It is up to the user to do it. One must make sure not to dispose of the color before the viewer has finished using it (i.e. is disposed).

        Parameters:
        color - new selection line color

      • getLineColorSelection

        public org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Color getLineColorSelection()
        Returns the color that will be sued when drawing selected lines.
        Returns:
        line color for selected lines
        See Also:
        getLineColorDefault()

      • update

        public void update()
        Updates this viewer.

        This operation redraws the viewer but if new elements were added to the model, this change will not be visualized.
